intro: Wormia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty worm moss, is a small, creeping plant belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a delicate, thread-like structure with closely spaced leaves that form a dense mat. It produces small, inconspicuous spore capsules that are clustered at the tips of its stems. Wormia pulchella is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
